channel.title: RadioNowhere
channel.description: It's eclectic! It's eccentric! It's RadioNowhere!
channel.itunes:subtitle: RadioNowhere
channel.itunes:summary: It's eclectic! It's eccentric! It's RadioNowhere! RadioNowhere began in 2002 as a reaction to the lack of support commercial radio was giving to unsigned, forgotten and deleted artists. The station now has a devoted following in over 30 countries. Join Bigif, Christopher, Jessica, Jessie, Ley, Patrick, Peta, Piney, Rachel & Ruby as they take you on a musical journey around the world without leaving your easy chair! Enjoy music from such diverse acts as Alan Menken, Piero Piccioni, Screamin' Jay Hawkins, Jerry Goldsmith, Gillian Hills, Cashier No. 9, We Are Losers, Hello Moon, Squarehead, The Notas, The Debutantes, September Girls, The #1s, Lords Of The Underground, Glenn Miller And His Orchestra, Nat King Cole Trio, The Mills Brothers, Cab Calloway And His Orchestra, Carl Story And His Ramblin' Mountaineers, Amayenge, AC/DC, The Runaways, The Damned, The Wellington International Ukulele Orchestra, The Hunger Mountain Boys, The Lake Country Boys, British Sea Power, Sons and Daughters, Umalali, Fuck Buttons, Skint & Demoralised, The Seekers, Tom Robinson, Warren Zevon, Linda Ronstadt, The School, Tender Trap, Cosines, The ABC Club, Sea Lions, Orca Team, Joanna Gruesome, Body Count, September Girls, GHXST, Crocodiles, Elevator Suite, The Soundtrack Of Our Lives, Ann Stephens, Anthony Newley, Warren Zevon, The Mission, Sidney Bechet, Kay Hill, Yma Sumac, The Gun Club, The 5.6.7.8's, Rufus Thomas, Cliff Edwards, Carter Burwell, The Dinks, Donna Summer, Fats Domino, Bruce Ruffin, Elvis Presley, The Weather Girls, The Beatles, Donald Fagen, Tennis, Helium, The Railway Children, Magazine, The Apples In Stereo, Demdike Stare, The Lovely Eggs, Dirty Three, Johnny Cash, Mack Self, Merle Haggard, The Everly Brothers, Sammi Smith, Jim Reeves, Kurt Wagner, Harry Gregson-Williams, Adrian Corker, Ray La Montagne, Houses, Wild Nothing, Belle & Sebastian & much much more!!!
channel.itunes:author: RadioNowhere

item.title: Filmic 12.July.2012
item.description: Every month Filmic brings you film themes, songs from the movies, incidental tracks, dodgy covers and a few surprises. This edition features music from Alan Menken, Danny Elfman & Carly Simon.
item.itunes:subtitle: Every month Filmic brings you film themes, songs from the movies, incidental tracks, dodgy covers and a few surprises. This edition features music from Alan Menken, Danny Elfman & Carly Simon.
item.itunes:summary:
FILMIC 12.July.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK
Track/Composer-Artist/Film The Queen Wants Snow Killed/Alan Menken/Mirror Mirror Amari A Tutto I Costi/Piero Piccioni/Mimi Metallurgico Ferito Nell 'Onore I Put A Spell On You/Screamin' Jay Hawkins/Natural Born Killer The List of Adrian Messenger/Jerry Goldsmith/The Jerry Goldsmith Collection Vol:1 The Rarities Back To the Future Theme/Alan Silvestri/Back To the Future Men In Black 3-Main Title Revisited/Danny Elfman/Men In Black 3 Me Ole Bamboo/Sherman Brothers/Chitty Chitty Bang Bang Coconut Water/Traditional-Robert Mitchum/Calypso Is Like So! The Egg Travels/James Newton Howard/Dinosaur Wednesdays Child/John Barry/the Quiller Memorandum Silkwood Main Theme/George Delerue/Silkwood A Walk Round Ischia/Carol Rustichelli/Avanti Escape/Craig Armstring/Plunkett & McCleane South American Getaway/Burt Bacharach/Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid Coming Around Again/Carly Simon/Heartburn The Rampant Huner/Henry Jackman/Abraham Lincoln Vampire Hunter
If you would like me to play your favourite film theme or song, or let me know what your worst or best film remake is, this is how to chat with me:
email: ley@radionowhere.org twitter: FilmicRadio@twitter.com
You can now see a 'visual' Filmic at: http://pinterest.com/topofthestairs/filmicradio
And lastly if you like what you hear please do send a small or large donation to: http://www.radionowhere.org/Donate.htm
Cheers, Ley
item.itunes:author: Ley Bricknell

item.title: Love Action's Friday Fix 6.July.2012
item.description: Jessie offers a monthly early-morning musical groove to give you that Friday feeling and kick start your weekend. This Indietracks edition features music from The School, September Girls & Veronica Falls.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jessie offers a monthly early-morning musical groove to give you that Friday feeling and kick start your weekend. This Indietracks edition features music from The School, September Girls & Veronica Falls.
item.itunes:summary:
Love Action's Friday Fix 6.July.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK
This month I have a very special show, featuring a heap of bands that are performing at this year's Indietracks Festival. I'm one of the lucky people who isn't just going to Indietracks, but I have the honor to perform with my band! The entire lineup is fantastic, so despite the dreary forecast, it should be a great weekend anyways. If you're lucky enough to be heading down, hopefully this hour of music will get you excited, and if you're not able to go... just close your eyes, listen and pretend!
On the show this month: Never Thought I'd See the Day - The School Girls With Guns - Tender Trap Hey Sailor Boy! - Cosines Scattered Light - The ABC Club I Don't Wanna Go Out - Sea Lions Ocean Ghost - Orca Team Pantry Girl - Joanna Gruesome Secret Lovers - September Girls Skisse #3 - Love Dance Another Day - Echo Lake A January Moon - The June Brides Somers Town - Jasmine Minks How Is This Even A Job? - This Many Boyfriends Jake Ryan - Summer Camp Swollen Hearts, Bitten Tongues - Young Romance Bury Me - Girls Names Beachy Head - Veronica Falls And Just Like That - The Hobbes Fanclub Jesus Wants Me For A Sunbeam - The Vaselines
Many of the tunes in this month's show can be purchased through the Indietracks Festival Bandcamp page. http://indietracks.bandcamp.com/ 50 tracks for only one pound! Can't argue with that! YEOW! Plus backing music is the soundtrack was Frenesi - Twist by Les Elgart & His Orchestra. Enjoy, and please feel free to send on requests - especially your guilty pleasures - for next month's show to: jessie@radionowhere.org! and of course you can follow me on twitter at twitter.com/jessieluvaction
item.itunes:author: Jessie Ward

item.title: Jessica 6 3.July.2012
item.description: Jessica 6 travels through time the 1st Tuesday of each month. This edition features music from the 1930s - expect to hear from Glenn Miller And His Orchestra, McKinney’s Cotton Pickers & Meade Lux Lewis.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jessica 6 travels through time the 1st Tuesday of each month. This edition features music from the 1930s - expect to hear from Glenn Miller And His Orchestra, McKinney’s Cotton Pickers & Meade Lux Lewis.

item.title: The Library Of Sound 20.June.2012
item.description: Join Patrick and Rachel the 3rd Wednesday of each month as they showcase their musical tastes and their inimitable banter. This edition features music from Joe Innes & The Cavalcade, Cathy Davey & tUnE-yArDs.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Patrick and Rachel the 3rd Wednesday of each month as they showcase their musical tastes and their inimitable banter. This edition features music from Joe Innes & The Cavalcade, Cathy Davey & tUnE-yArDs.
item.itunes:summary:
Library Of Sound 20.June.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK @LibraryOfSound
Welcome back to the library for June’s show. Rachel’s been raiding the Irish Music section to find some of her favourites and Patrick’s been busy discovering some new editions!
1. Rhob Cunningham/Our Little Secrets - Her Cup and Her Arms
2. Joe Innes & The Cavalcade - Pet Cemetary
3. Delorentos - Care For
4. Pale Seas - Something or Nothing
5. Cathy Davey - In He Comes
6. Dutch Uncles - Fragrant
7. Thao & Mirah - Little Cup
8. Like Spinning - Forces
9. tUnE-yArDs - My Country
10. Francois & The Atlas Mountains - Piscine
item.itunes:author: Patrick Burke & Rachel Devlin

item.title: The Doggone History of Country Music 16.June.2012

item.title: RadioNowhere's Best of 2011
item.description: The staff of RadioNowhere.org unveil their choices for the Best of 2011.
item.itunes:subtitle: The staff of RadioNowhere.org unveil their choices for the Best of 2011.
item.itunes:summary:
RadioNowhere's Best of 2011 19.December.2011 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @radionowhereuk @lairdofnowhere @bigifdj @jessica6uk @timtenyen @LibraryOfSound @ChickyBoilUps @FilmicRadio @jessieluvaction @HipAuntie @PineyGir
Compiled by the staff at RadioNowhere.org: Bigif, Ley Bricknell, Patrick Burke, Rachel Devlin, Piney Gir, Jessica 6, Christopher Laird, Judy Neuhaus, Tim Ten Yen, Peta Waddington, Jessie Ward O’Sullivan & Ruby Wright.
‘If it’s good, they’ll find it’ ~ The New York Times
‘Songs from the best new independent artists’ ~ The Guardian
RadioNowhere’s Song of the Year - LA FEMME: Sur La Planche
RadioNowhere’s Album of the Year - BEARSUIT: The Phantom Forest
RadioNowhere’s Promotional Video of the Year - PAPA TOPO: La Chica Vampira
(complete running order)
